marcus_opens_up.speaker: Narrator
marcus_opens_up.text: Marcus has been staring out the window for some time. There's a weight in his eyes today.

choices.text: Ask if he wants his usual order

sit_quietly.speaker: Marcus
sit_quietly.text: *After a long silence* I wasn't always a wanderer, you know. I had a home once. A purpose.

offer_food.speaker: Marcus
offer_food.text: Food... yes. Food was always how she showed she cared too. *He laughs sadly* Sit down. I think I need to tell someone.

marcus_past_1.speaker: Marcus
marcus_past_1.text: I was a guild master once. We protected a town - good people, families, children. They trusted us. Trusted ME.

marcus_past_2.speaker: Marcus
marcus_past_2.text: Then the raiders came. A night attack, overwhelming numbers. I made a call - told the guild to fall back, regroup.

marcus_failure.speaker: Marcus
marcus_failure.text: We saved the guild. But the town... *His voice breaks* Fifteen families. Gone. Because I chose to retreat.

marcus_confession.speaker: Marcus
marcus_confession.text: I've been running ever since. Can't stay in one place. Keep moving, keep helping where I can, and maybe someday the scales will balance.

choices.text: You made an impossible choice. That doesn't make you a coward.
You're still helping people. That has to count for something.

comfort_marcus.speaker: Marcus
comfort_marcus.text: *He looks at you, surprised* No one's ever... thank you. Maybe that's why I keep coming back here.

encourage_marcus.speaker: Marcus
encourage_marcus.text: Count for something... *He considers this* Perhaps. Perhaps running isn't the only way to atone.

marcus_resolve.speaker: Marcus
marcus_resolve.text: You know what? I think I might stay a while. This cafe... you... there's something worth protecting here.
